Her dream is to have her own house, enable her children to continue their education and have a good career.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, extension cords, cables, counters, electricity meters, electric resistors

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is 48 years old, married and lives at Solana with his family. 

He is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He manages his rice field well so his crops will produce abundant harvest. 

He wants to improve his output but has insufficient funds to buy farm inputs that are necessary to sustain his crops. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

He hopes to keep ensuring good income in his business to provide the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rosel works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  

Rosel is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 49 years old, married, and has six children. Leonida works very hard to provide for them.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, rice, eggs and other groceries.

Leonida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Leonida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Alice works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a bakery. 

Alice is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms and other clothing to sell.

Alice has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms and other clothing.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Analyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is listing Analyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Juvy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is relisting Juvy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 52 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mercedes has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Mercedes requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her business.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 26 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Jenelyn has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits to sell in her food stall. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Genevieve works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. 

Genevieve is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Genevieve has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 36 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Amy works very hard to provide for them.

Amy runs a general store in the Philippines. Amy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Amy would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Doña Marta, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa en una aldea del municipio de Petoa, Santa Barbara. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa de manera ambulante pero hace 5 años estableció su negocio de una pulpería en su casa para vender productos alimenticios que le generara más ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hija. Vende granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, harina, churros, refrescos, pan, huevos, condimentos y otros. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar más productos de granos básicos, quesos, carnes, refrescos, churros, pan, harina etc. Y mantener mejor inventario para mejorar los ingresos. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y mantenerse estable económicamente.
texts.en:
Marta is 56 years old and is a single mother. She has a daughter with whom she lives in a village in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Barbara. She used to sell clothing itinerantly but 5 years ago established her business, a small store, in her house where she sells food products which generate more income to sustain her daughter. She sells basic grains, sugar, lard, flour, snacks, soft drinks, bread, eggs, condiments and others.

She has requested a loan of 10,000HNL to buy more products: basic grains, cheese, meat, soft drinks, snacks, bread , flour, etc. and maintain better inventory to improve her income. Her plan is to expand her business and maintain a stable economy.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cheese, meats, soft drinks, snacks, bread, flour, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 22 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jovelyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional fruits to sell in her business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell in her business.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is 48 years old and married.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Yvette is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a manicure business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
La distribución y mantenimiento de celulares es un negocio sumamente amplio, por la creciente demanda hacia los móviles. Carlos consiente de esto e impulsado por sus deseos de ser independiente y microempresario, se animó a poner su local. Cabe destacar, que su mayor apuesta por este trabajo fue, porque anteriormente trabajó en una empresa donde vendía accesorios de celulares, y ahí pudo valorar la rentabilidad y las herramientas para continuar él por su parte. 
Carlos 	solicita el crédito para adquirir nuevos modelos de celulares y accesorios, ya que al tratarse de tecnología debe ofrecer productos de última generación. Además, su negocio se caracteriza por ofrecer variedad y calidad a sus clientes.  Este hombre emprendedor desea abrir una sucursal en otro pueblo, para seguir creciendo como persona y empresario, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The distribution and maintenance of cellphones is a very broad business due to the growing demand for mobile phones. Carlos is conscious of this and driven by his desire to be independent and a micro-entrepreneur opened a store. It should be highlighted that his main inclination for this work was because he previously worked in a business that sold cellphone accessories so he could understand the profits and equipment to continue on his own.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy new models of cellphones and accessories as dealing in technology you must offer the latest generation of products. Also his business is based on offering variety and quality to his customers. This enterprising man wants to open a branch in another city to continue to grow as a person and businessman which will permit him to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to acquire new models of cellphones and accessories.

loans.name: Luis Lucio

texts.es:
Luis Lucio tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto con su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda servicio de transporte en el distrito de Pucará desde hace tres años, también brinda servicio de alquiler de habitaciones a diversos estudiantes y trabajadores de la zona. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Luis Lucio espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Lucio is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará, a community with a hot climate where people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

Luis works providing public transportation. He has his own motorcycle with which he has offered transportation services in the district of Pucará for the past 3 years. He also rents rooms to different students and workers in the area. He has experience in his business and very good personal and work references in the district.

He is requesting a loan to make repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle as it currently is in bad condition. Doing this Luis hopes to offer better service to his clients which will generate more income. He will be able to obtain a better quality of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to undertake repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle as it currently is in poor condition.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 35 years old and married with three children who are all currently in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fehmida Begum

texts.en:
Fehmida Begum is a 34-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and seven children.

Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years, and only he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Fehmida Begum's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories), but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these above items for his business purposes. Therefore, Fehmida Begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Fehmida Begum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items for tailoring shop

loans.name: Shazia Perveen

texts.en:
Shazia Perveen is a 32-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years, and only he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Shazia Perveen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories), but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items listed above for his business purposes. Therefore, Shazia Perveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Shazia Perveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring shop

loans.name: Mardonkul

texts.en:
Mardonkul is a very experienced man. He was born in 1966. He is from the northern part of the country. He is living in a remote district. He is married. He has been a businessman for about 20 years; he is a farmer. He has great experience in farming. He buys, keeps, feeds and sells livestock. He has satisfied clients in the domestic market. He tries to feed his livestock well in order to sell them for an extra price. 

He wants to enlarge his activity. Mardonkul is asking for financial support to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock

loans.name: Nazirakhon

texts.en:
Nazirakhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1969. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Nazirakhon is the main feed keeper of her family. She has a higher pedagogical education. Nazirakhon has worked hard every day for more than 15 years in a school. She has a small salary, and she has additional income from buying and selling children's clothes. She buys in a bulk, and sells in a local market. Nazirakhon tries to offer high quality clothes to her customers, and in this way to attract more customers. 

Nazirakhon always wanted to see her children as highly educated people. Her daughter is a student. She studies in the capital of Tajikistan. 

Nazirakhon must pay for the education of her daughter, and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for education of her daughter

loans.name: Luis Jaens

texts.es:
Luis tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la venta de gallinas, pavos, patos, cabritos, cerdos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, entre otros, así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Luis espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores niveles de ingreso y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 51 tears old and in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials in the district of Pucará which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. Life in this district is quiet and the people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Luis works selling chickens, turkeys, ducks, goats, pigs, amongst others. He has more than 20 years experience in the field and has very good personal and work references from the area. The loan will be used to buy a greater number of animals like pigs chickens and ducks, amongst others as well as balanced feed to fatten them . Doing this Luis hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his clients which will generate a higher level of income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals likes pigs, chickens, ducks, amongst others as well as balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Tahira Bibi

texts.en:
Tahira Bibi is a 38-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Tahira Bibi is also providing sewing services, and earns the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She is in need of different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories, and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Tahira Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc

loans.name: Shara Jane

texts.en:
Shara Jane is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shara Jane is 34 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Shara Jane has a food vending business in the Philippines. Shara Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Shara Jane has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Shara Jane would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Amina Bibi

texts.en:
Amina Bibi is a 41-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for ten years, and only he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Amina Bibi's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories), but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items listed above for his business purpose. Therefore, Amina Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Amina Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Sahib Jan

texts.en:
Sahib Jan is a 48-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years, and only he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Sahib Jan's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories), but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items listed above for his business purposes. Therefore, Sahib Jan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Sahib Jan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items to increase her husband's business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad has a housing loan from Esperanza International. This is her 13th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had a household products sales business for over seven years, which she started with her first Esperanza loan. With her last loan, she increased her inventory. Trinidad is a single mother of five children; she only lives with 2 of them. She works and lives in the rural town in Hato Mayor. She will use this loan to buy cement to cover her concrete block walls and also will buy windows to finish building her house. 

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time running their business and attending their group meetings. Trinidad thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy zinc, concrete blocks, sand and other items.

loans.name: Felaugaina

texts.en: Felaugaina is a 30-year-old woman with two children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei (block print) materials at the market to earn a living. Felaugaina has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Dinora

texts.en:
Dinora is the mother of four children, and one of them lives with her and her husband. She works and lives in the rural town in Hato Mayor. She will use this loan to buy doors, cement, windows and tiles, to finish building her house. 

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown fidelity to their groups. The program allows them to take out loans to improve the structure of their houses, while running their businesses and attending their group meetings. 

Dinora has requested a housing loan. This is her 13th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her perfume, shoes and accessories business for over six years. With her last loan, she increased the inventory of her store, where she sells miscellaneous goods. She thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy doors, windows and other building material

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia works hard to support her family. Celia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Celia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like noodles, shampoo, canned goods, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Celia has been in this business for 14 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like noodles, shampoo, canned goods, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old, married, and has seven children.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in this business for 25 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, vitamins and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is a 63-year-old widow woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Enriqueta has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 24,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Enriqueta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Lidia Antonia

texts.es:
Lidia Antonia es una joven de veintiocho años, muy esforzada. Se enfrenta a la vida con su mejor sonrisa, por su bien y el de su pequeño hijo de tres años. Ella valora el hecho de estar en la universidad estudiando contabilidad y aunque ha tenido tiempos difíciles estos no la han alejado de su meta, la cual es ser una profesional exitosa en el área de las finanzas.
Ella distribuye su tiempo entre un trabajo de medio tiempo y la universidad, para poder proveerle a su pequeño lo necesario. Su único soporte es el de sus padres, los cuales están jubilados. Ahora en la recta final de su carrera no cuenta con el capital completo para cancelar los gastos de sus estudios y así egresar de la universidad. Por esta razón es que ella deposita sus esperanzas en Kiva a través de MiCrédito para realizar su sueño, solicitado un crédito para pagar su curso de titulación.  Con esto podrá comenzar a buscar un trabajo de tiempo completo para salir adelante como la mujer con visión hacia el futuro que es.
texts.en: Lidia Antonia is a 28-year-old young woman and very dedicated. She faces the world with her best smile, for her own good and for the good of her three-year-old son. Lidia Antonia values the fact that she is studying accounting at the university and, although she has had some difficult times, she has not wavered from her goal of becoming a successful financial professional. She divides her time between a part-time job and her university studies in order to provide for her son's needs. Her only support is that of her parents, who are retired. Now that she is in the final stretch of her studies, she lacks the necessary funds to pay for her university registration fees. Thus, she is pinning her hopes on Kiva via MiCrédito to make her dream come true and is requesting a loan to pay for her university-level studies. This will enable her to search for a full-time job to improve her prospects in a manner befitting a forward-looking woman such as herself.

loans.use: to pay for her university-level studies.

loans.name: Alma Reina

texts.es:
Alma, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea rural del Municipio de Gracias Lempira junto a dos de sus hijos.
Ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijoles y café, también cultiva hortalizas. La producción de café y hortalizas la vende en el mercado local de la zona.
Doña Alma ha solicitado un séptimo ciclo de préstamo a ODEF por 10,000 Lempiras para compra de abonos, fertilizante y semillas para cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hortalizas. Con esta inversión ella espera cultivar una parcela mas  para obtener ingresos para el bienestar familiar.
Su meta es seguir comprando mas tierras para aumentar los cultivos para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Alma is a 36 year old single mother with 5 children. She lives in a rural village in the municipality of Gracias Lempira together with her children. She has been working in agriculture growing corn, beans, coffee and she also grows vegetables. She sells her coffee and vegetables in the local market of the district.

Alma has requested her 7th loan from ODEF for 10,000 HNL to purchase manure, fertilizer and seeds to grow corn beans and vegetables. With this investment she hopes to plant another plot to generate income for her family's well-being. Her goal is to continue buying more land to increase her crops to provide a better quality of living to her children and provide them their education.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds to grow corn, beans and vegetables.

loans.name: Jaime Jacinto

texts.es:
Todos los días de la semana, Jaime, junto a su esposa, se levanta desde las cinco de la mañana para arreglar su carreta donde venden frutas. Desde hace más de quince años, este joven era obrero, pues sentía que debía trabajar para salir adelante con su familia. Ahora, sin dejar ningún segundo ese espíritu familiar, tiene una carreta donde vende frutas de forma ambulante, para poder sustentar su hogar. Jaime está casado y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, quienes no tardan en comenzar el colegio. 
Jaime viaja por todo su pueblo para promocionar sus frutas, por lo que es bastante reconocido por sus vecinos. A sus 29 años de edad es un hombre con visión y muy emprendedor, por lo que no duda en invertir en su negocio. Por esta razón es que solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas de la temporada, mango, banano, mandarinas, naranjas, entre otras. Esta compra le ayudará a diversificar su mercadería y aumentar sus ingresos. En sus planes está llegar a tener un puesto estable donde vender sus tan reconocidas frutas.
texts.en:
Jaime and his wife rise at 5 a.m., seven days a week, to prepare to sell fruit from their cart. The couple has two children, ages six and four, who are just starting to attend school and pursue their education. 

Jaime was a laborer over 15 years ago, but felt he had to find work that would provide more security for his family. Today, still completely devoted to that family, Jaime sells fruit from the cart on the streets so that he can support his household.  

Jaime goes all over town selling fruit, and is thus well-known to his neighbors. Just 29 years old, he has a strong sense for business and a vision, so he doesn't hesitate to invest in his business. He's therefore applying for a loan so he can purchase seasonal fruit: mangoes, bananas, oranges, mandarin oranges, and others. This investment will help Jaime diversify the products he offers his customers and boost his income. He'd also like to set up a shop where he can sell popular fruits.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Rasheeda Bibi

texts.en:
Rasheeda Bibi, 40, resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of 7 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past six years. He is the only person responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Rasheeda Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products. 

Therefore, Rasheeda bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities, which will help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Rasheeda bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband improve his business.

loans.name: Glenda Liceth

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer que día a día lucha para salir adelante. Ella tiene un hijo el cual estudia en tercer grado viviendo con ella una sobrina y la empleada doméstica. Ella es madre soltera y diariamente lucha para dar a su hijo un mejor estilo de vida, apoyarle con sus estudios y las necesidades básicas. Su grado de estudio es de secundaria completa la cual se graduó como bachiller en ciencia y letras y técnico en computación. Para generar los ingresos en su hogar ella se levanta temprano por la mañana ya que mientras no está en el campo ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de segunda y abarrotería donde vende productos de la canasta básica la cual ha trabajado por más de 8 años. Su principal necesidad son sus cultivos de café ya que se acerca la temporada donde tiene que dar un mayor cuidado el mismo para que la flor sea más provechosa y el grano pesado. Ella Solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para que la cosecha de café en esta temporada sea de mucho provecho, ella necesita aplicar a sus cultivos abono 12-24-12, abono orgánico, fertilizantes, formula de crecimiento y el pago de mano de obra para llevar a cabo un mejor aprovechamiento sobre la aplicación en sus cultivos. Sus metas seguir incrementando sus cultivos, sembrar una mejor variedad pare ser competitivo en el mercado y atractivo para el cliente e intermediario.
texts.en:
Glenda is a single mother and entrepreneur who strives diligently and persistently each day to succeed, managing two small businesses on top of growing coffee. She sells second-hand clothing and for the past eight years has also run a small grocery store. Her household consists of her son, who is in the third grade, a niece who also lives with her, and their housekeeper. A top priority for Glenda is ensuring that she can meet her son's basic needs and provide for his education. Glenda herself is a high school graduate who studied liberal arts, sciences, and information technology. 

Glenda gets up early every morning to earn a living, attending to her clothing business and her store when she's not working with her coffee crops. This is the time of year, however, when the coffee plants need more attention so that the beans will grow large and the crop will be profitable. Glenda is therefore applying for a loan for the purchase of supplies that she needs for the harvest: 12-24-12 manure, organic manure, fertilizers, growth formula. She will also use part of the loan funds to pay laborers who will help her apply these items to her crops. 

Glenda hopes to keep growing coffee and to plant a better variety that will make her competitive in the marketplace, with an enticing coffee crop for customers and wholesalers.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and to pay laborers who will help care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en:
Palolo is a 43-year-old mother with 6 children.

She runs and operates a small business of selling fish in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Palolo has requested a loan to buy a canoe, container, ice bag, and fishing gear to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future. Palolo became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a canoe, container, ice bag, and fishing gear

loans.name: Zohidjon

texts.en: Zohidjon is a hardworking man. He was born in 1965. He lives in rural area. He is married. His wife is a housekeeper. He is a brave, honest, responsible and conscientious person. He is a master of his job. He is a baker. He bakes very tasty and delicious bread. He has good experience working and attracts many clients. All clients are satisfied from his activity. He earns enough for the needs and expenditures of everyday life for his family. The place of his activity is in bad condition. He needs to repair his place of work and buy a new oven. He requested 5,000 TJS in order to cover the repair expenditures and buy a new oven. He is pleased to be supported by Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his place of work and buy a new oven.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Doña Paula con sus 55 años es una mujer luchadora y muy dinámica la cual agradece por los dos créditos anteriores  para poder asistir sus cultivos de café. Con cada uno de ellos, ella ha logrado aumentar y mejorar la producción y volumen en cada temporada, logrando ampliar su cafetal y poder sembrar al mismo tiempo pequeños metros de maíz y frijol pues como agricultora tiene los conocimientos y mano necesaria para llevar a cabo una buena cosecha.  Ello logro cancelar su segundo crédito con mucha satisfacción ya que ella manifiesta que es la única forma de poder agradecer el apoyo no quedando mal con la institución para que no dejen de creer. Ella solicita su tercer crédito siempre para invertirlo en la compra de abono, plaguicida, foliares pago de mano de obra entre otros que ayudaran a mejorar aún más la plantación existente y protección de la misma.
texts.en: Ms. Paula, at 55 years of age, is a courageous and dynamic woman who is thankful for the previous two loans she was given to attend to her coffee plantation. Each of them enabled her to increase and improve crop production and yield during each season. They also enabled her to expand her plantation and simultaneously plant a few meters with corn and beans. As a farmer, she already had the necessary knowledge and manpower to achieve a good harvest. To her great satisfaction, this enabled her to pay her second loan. She says that paying her loan as agreed is the only way to express her gratitude to the organization. That way, they will continue to have faith in borrowers. Ms. Paula is requesting her third loan, as always, to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, foliar fertilizer, and labor costs--among other things--in order to further improve and protect her coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay labor costs in order to attend to her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Fareeda Ijaz

texts.en:
Fareeda Ijaz is a 35-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Fareeda Ijaz has been running her own beauty salon for the past twenty years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
Fareeda Ijaz needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items. Therefore, Fareeda Ijaz has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also help her to earn the maximum profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Fareeda Ijaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her business.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis was born in 1967. She is married and has three children. Nargis’s husband is a Habibullo. He is a entrepreneur. Nargis is also a businesswoman. She has been busy with buying and selling clothes in a local market. Nargis little by little with the passing of the time perfected her knowledge. Now, she has a lot of experience in business and she manages the business alone. 

Nargis’s daughter is a student. She studies in Russia. Nargis must pay for the education of her daughter and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to pay for her daughter's education. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has a housing loan from Esperanza International. This is her 16th loan, which she will use to improve her house into a safe and tranquil house. She has had a butcher shop and a beauty salon for more than nine years, funded with her first Esperanza loan. With her last loan, she increased inventory. 

Juana is a single mother of one child. She works and lives in a rural town in San Pedro de Macoris. She will use this loan to buy concrete blocks, cement and other building materials to improve her house from a weak wood structure. 

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time they are running their business and attending their group meetings. Juana thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement and other building materials.

loans.name: Pesi

texts.en:
Pesi is 39 years old with seven children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years. 

Pesi has requested a loan to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2009, and she hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Tuutuuiluga

texts.en: Tuutuuiluga is 26 years old with 3 children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Tuutuuiluga has requested a loan to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc roofing and other building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials, cement, concrete blocks, etc. to improve her house.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanesa is a 35-year-old mother with one child. She owns and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Vanesa has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and containers to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and containers.

loans.name: Solialii

texts.en:
Solialii is a 47-year-old mother with seven children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Solialii has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, chemicals and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, chemicals and hand gloves.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a widow. She is 26 years old. Nilufar does not have any children. She lives with her parents. 

Nilufar wants to start her own business to get ahead. She is going to start business selling food items. With this goal, she took part in a course, "To Get Ahead," by a women's organization and received a certificate. Nilufar now needs financial support to buy food items and to start her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy food items for starting her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items for starting a business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 22 años y una hija mujer de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’ lugar caracterizado por sus orígenes; campesino aymaras que pelearon por la liberación del yugo español y se asentaron en ese lugar como trinchera, se encuentra sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco durante todo el año
Eva es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el Aymara que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian; el mayor estudia una carrera técnica y la menor en la escuela. Viven en una casa de la familia que cuenta con agua potable, alcantarillado y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería, como; lápices, bolígrafos, cuadernos, hojas blancas, papel de colores, reglas, marcadores, etc. Labor que realiza durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, los domingos se dedica a su familia; realizando paseos, y limpieza del hogar. Sus artículos de librería tienen ventas constantes debido a que vende cerca de los colegios, las ventas bajan en época de vacaciones, utilizando esas fechas para realizar el inventario y reposición de los materiales faltantes. “el inicio de clases es la época dónde no se para de vender, en época de vacaciones cambio de rubro, ese es buen momento para realizar el inventario…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una librería. Ella desea abastecer su stock con material escolar como libros, textos escolares, cuentos, cuadernos y otros, para comenzar el nuevo año escolar preparada con todos los materiales necesarios para la oferta. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para la compra de material escolar para abastecer su stock y recibir a los niños con todo el material escolar.
texts.en:
Eva is 44 years old and single. She has a 22-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Her business is the sales of bookstore items.

She is a good mother, independent, enterprising, patient, a good listener, caring, responsible, and she works hard.

She sells as a street vendor in the "Pampahasi" zone, which is known for its origins: Aymará farmers fighting for independence from the Spanish rule entrenched the zone and settled there. This zone is on a slope of the city on steep, high streets. It is an area of cold, dry climate throughout the year.

Eva has a dark complexion, short stature, and long braided black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymará, spoken at home, and she also knows Spanish, spoken in the community and which she uses for business. She shares her life with her children who are studying, the older pursuing a technical degree, the younger in primary school. They live in a family home that has running water, sewer service, and electricity.

She earns a living selling bookstore items, such as pencils, pens, notebooks, white paper sheets, colored paper, rulers, markers, etc. She works all day from Monday to Saturday. Sunday is for the family, taking a stroll, and cleaning the house.

She has steady sales for her bookstore items, since she sells close to the schools. Sales go down during school vacations, time that she uses for inventorying and restocking. "When classes start, I sell non-stop. During vacations, I switch to inventorying, that's a good time for it" she comments. She dreams of having a bookstore.

Eva wants to replenish her stock with school materials such as books, school texts, storybooks, notebooks, and other items. She wants to begin the new school year ready with all the necessary supplies, and this is why she is asking for the loan.

This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the five years that she's been doing this work.

loans.use: to buy school items in order to restock her supplies and receive the children with all school materials available.

loans.name: Lucitania

texts.en:
Lucitania, from the city of Hato Mayor, is taking a housing loan. This is her second loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has a communications business where she sells prepaid cards for mobile phones, having started it with her first loan from Esperanza. Her latest loan was invested in the business.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown faithfulness in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as they are running their businesses and attending their group meetings. 

Lucitania wants to start building her house. With this loan, she will buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, sand and other building materials. She wishes to have a safe and nice home to share with her four children and her long term partner. Thanks to God's will, she will be able to save money to finish building her house with her business profits. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. On behalf of her and her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, sand and other building materials.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
Abdujabbor is a communicative person. He is from the eastern part of the country. He lives in a rural area. He was born in 1984. He is married, and his wife is a housekeeper.

For more than ten years, he has been a seller. He has good experience of working and is well known among workers.

Abdujabbor is seeking 1,800 somoni for a vacation. He needs to relax because his work is hard. He is planning to buy a vacation trip in order to refresh his health. Abdujabbor is requesting financial support to have a vacation for treatment.

loans.use: to have a vacation for treatment.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 37 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Cheryl has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains.

Roselyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for resale

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 44 years old with two children. With her two children in school, Edelina works very hard to provide for them.

Edelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, and other groceries.

Edelina has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Edelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Bebena

texts.en:
Bebena is 24 years old and has one child. She is married, and her child is still in school.

Bebena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bebena has been in business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Don José es un emprendedor por excelencia, pues los negocios siempre han estado en sus venas. Inició trabajando en el negocio familiar de venta de ladrillos. Sin embargo, él sentía la necesidad de hacerse auto sostenible, pero en una área diferente. Así que sin tener la mínima experiencia, abrió una panadería y con apoyo de su familia logró sacarla adelante. 
Lo que comenzó titubeante ahora lo llena de orgullo, pues demostró que no es un impedimento no tener experiencia,  porque estamos para aprender día a día y crecer como personas. Actualmente, solicita el crédito para la comprar de materia prima como harina, huevos, mantequilla y levadura. Los planes de don José son expandir su negocio y  hacer más variedad en su panadería.
texts.en: Don José is the quintessential entrepreneur; business has always been in his blood. He began by working in his family's brick-selling business. However, he felt the need to become independent in a different field. Thus, without any prior experience, he opened a bakery and--with his family's support--was able to make the business thrive. That which began hesitantly now fills him with pride, as he demonstrated that lack of experience is not an obstacle, that every day is an opportunity to learn and grow as individuals. Don José is currently requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as flour, eggs, butter, and yeast. He plans to expand his business and bake a broader range of goods.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, eggs, butter, and yeast.

loans.name: Shazia Parveen

texts.en:
Shazia Parveen is 49 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 15 years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Shazia Parveen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Shazia Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Shazia Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase items for resale at his general store.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German, tiene 28 años de edad, esta soltero, vive en su casa que esta ubicada en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en la siembra de maíz y frijoles. También se dedica al cultivo de café porque ha salido más rentable, este café lo vende en grano en pergamino en húmedo y seco. Para este cultivo ha decidido obtener un prestamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y pago de mano de obra en la fertilización y limpieza de la finca. Su objetivo es lograr mejor cosecha de café y mejores ingresos que le ayuden a vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Germán, 28, is single and lives in his house in a village in the town of Gracias, Lempira.  He has always worked in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He also grows coffee because it's more profitable.  He sells the coffee in parchment, wet processed and dry processed.

He has decided to get a loan for 12,000 lempiras [HNL] for his coffee crop, to buy soil amendments and to pay for labor to fertilize and clear the farm.

Germán's goal is to have a better coffee crop and more income to help him live better.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and to pay for labor to fertilize and clear his coffee farm

loans.name: Fareeda Begum

texts.en:
Fareeda Begum is a 35-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for ten years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Fareeda Begum's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Fareeda Begum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to obtain these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs.

For this financial assistance, Fareeda Begum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business.

loans.name: Shabnam Bashir

texts.en:
Shabnam Bashir is 23 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop and is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the need of all family members. Shabnam Bashir has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years. She also contributes her income to management of the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes. Therefore Shabnam Bashir has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Shabnam Bashir is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items needed for her beauty salon so she can provide better services.

loans.name: Raimshoh

texts.en:
Raimshoh is a married parent of 3 children. He is a very hardworking and smart man.

Raimshoh lives with his family in a village.  He has been busy with an agricultural business for more than 15 years. He grows vegetables and crops on land. He has great experience in this field and little by little develops the business.

Raimshoh is going to make a new sowing of vegetables but he does not have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en:
Roseta is a 44-year-old mother with eight children. She operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Roseta has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan and wooden spoons to assist her with the business. She will use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan and wooden spoons.

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for rice grains and to pay for laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Elinita has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and to pay for laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Florel

texts.en:
Florel is 33 years old, and is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. Florel requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Florel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 34 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs to sell at her store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs to sell at her store.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en:
Clovice used the previous loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation and farm by buying fertilizer. Clovice is a married man with seven children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells ground nuts and at the same time sells milk and bananas. In his business, he faces the hardship of price fluctuation, which hinders his business growth. In spite of this, he hopes to buy cattle for rearing. 

Clovice has asked for a loan to buy groundnuts for selling.

loans.use: to buy goundnuts for selling.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary works hard to support her family. Rosemary is married and has a business buying and selling vegetable in the Philippines. Rosemary has been in this business for nine years. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (Kiva's partner) to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 48 years old with three children.

Emilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Emilia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Emilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 47 years old and married with three children.

Eufemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as candies, toys, juices, groceries, etc.

Eufemia has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Eufemia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as candies, toys, juices, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a hardworking woman with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy sugar, salt and soap, among other items, for resale. 

In her business, she faces the challenge of customers defaulting her, and this leads to low profits. Besides that, Resty has hopes of buying a plot in town on which to build a restaurant. She has asked for a loan to buy chairs, utensils and tables for use in her business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, utensils and tables for use in her business.

loans.name: Andriansyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet Andri, one of Ruma's agents. This is the third time he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he has learned how to improve his business. He feels that he can give a good contribution to his community through his small business as well. 

Andri lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. He owns a stall where he sells drinking water and provides mobile  payment services to his community. As the business continues, Andri needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Andri improve his business and accordingly, his community who need access to such services. As seen in the photo, Andri is standing in his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile services for his community

loans.name: Nubia Mayela

texts.es:
Lo que para muchos podría ser un fin simple obstáculo para terminar sus estudios, para Nubia fue la oportunidad perfecta para iniciar su propio negocio. Esta joven de 22 años estaba en una etapa donde su madre no tenía cómo pagar sus estudios, por lo que decidió empezar a hacer y vender tortillas para obtener ingresos para sus estudios y para su familia. Ahora ya tiene dos años con su negocio de tortillas y su título universitario.  
Pero sus sueños no terminaron ahí, puesto que Nubia comenzó a comprar ropa y venderlas desde su casa. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá, por lo que se siente más segura. Esta emprendedora quiere seguir creciendo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa, en especial uniformes escolares, zapatos, calcetines, mochilas y loncheras, para poder aprovechar el regreso a clases. La variedad de productos le ayudará a generar mayor ganancias y continuar con su negocio como lo sueña. En sus planes está conseguir un trabajo acorde a sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nubia faced challenges that many people would have seen as insurmountable; she saw those obstacles as as an opportunity to start a business. Nubia was just 22 years old and her family's financial situation was tenuous; her mother couldn't afford to pay her tuition. Nubia therefore decided to start a business selling tortillas in order to earn income to pay for her studies and help her family. She's been running the business for two years now and has also earned a university degree. Nubia, however, has not yet fulfilled her ambitions, and has started a second business buying clothing and accessories and selling them from her home. She's fortunate to have the support of her mother, which makes her feel more secure as she starts this second business.  

Nubia wants to keep growing her new business, so she's applying for a loan to purchase clothing and accessories: school uniforms, shoes, socks, backpacks and lunchboxes. Such a variety of items will help Nubia generate higher income and continue fulfilling her ambitions to run a successful business. She hopes in the future to find a job in the field she studied in college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with four children, and all go to school. She has no additional family members.

She sells bunches of green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT - SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.

Her major business challenge is transportation. She would like to expand her business into farming. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ahlidin

texts.en:
Ahlidin is a hardworking man. He was born in 1964. He is living in a rural area and he is married. He has a family business where all members of his family are attracted. He has four children. 

Ahlidin is a responsible, brave, honest and helpful person. It is hard for him to cover all expenditures and everyday needs. For more than 15 years, he has had a family business of buying and selling agricultural products. The business is private and well known in the rural area. 

Ahlidin needs to send his son abroad. He is planning to buy a ticket for the flight. Ahlidin is requesting a loan of 2,500 TJS. He is merciful for Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for a flight for his son.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase plastic rope and seaweed seedlings.

Nilda has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase plastic rope and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old and married with five children. All of her children are in school, and Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as milk, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Eva has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as milk, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old with one child who is in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as eggs, cigarettes, candies, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as eggs, cigarettes, candies, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: As a parent of four children, Ginalyn works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income operating a general store. Ginalyn is borrowing 6000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase spare parts and other equipment needed for her bicycle transport business. Ginalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and married with eight children, 6 of whom are in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, milk, noodles, etc. Vilma has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 36-year-old married lady with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a retail shop, a business she started with the hope of employing herself. 

She is faced with the challenge of customers delaying in paying her, which causes her business to remain stagnant. 

She dreams of buying land and educating her children to higher levels of learning. 

Sarah has asked for a loan to buy cassava flour, maize flour, soap and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, maize flour, soap and rice for resale.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison used the previous loan to buy soap to sell at his store. Edison is a 40-year-old married man with four children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has run a retail shop business selling general merchandise for the plast four years and also does farming to supplement his income, growing cocoa.

He has been able to maintain his business and sustain his family, even though challenges of  price fluctuations alongside inadequate capital hinder his expectations. 

Edison intends to use the loan to buy soap, sugar, rice, salt and other items for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, rice, salt and other items for resale.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a forty-year-old woman and is married with six children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Asia sells tomatoes, a business she has operated since 2011, in order to earn a living and support all her children in attaining education. She needs a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell. She has a dream of expanding her business despite market competition and limited capital.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 29-year-old hard working man, married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Richard runs a retail shop of general merchandise which he started six years back. He gets additional income from farming, growing mostly coffee and cocoa. He has a dream of building a commercial and residential house. However, he is faced with the challenges of limited capital and price fluctuations, just like other retailers. Richard is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Noe Amael

texts.es: Noé, tiene 70 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, reside en el municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Don Noé lleva mas de 15 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende productos de la canasta básica como carnes, embutidos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, churros, azúcar y otros  y calzado escolar. La pulpería la administra junto con su esposa y también tiene un taller de zapatería, elabora zapato escolar para vender. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para sus actividades de negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios y surtir la pulpería como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, sal, café, refrescos, lácteos, carnes, productos de limpieza etc. y materiales como cuero, suelas, pegamento para elaborar zapatos. Su objetivo es mantener su negocio con mayor demanda y que su familia tenga calidad de vida.
texts.en: Noé is 70 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Mr. Noé has run a small grocery store for over 15 years. There, he sells basic products such as meat, cold cuts, cleaning products, soft drinks, churros, sugar, school shoes, and others. He manages the store alongside his wife and also runs a shoe repair shop where he makes school shoes for sale. He has previously requested several loans for his business and is now requesting another 10,000 Lempiras to buy food products to stock his store such as: rice, sugar, lard, salt, coffee, soft drinks, dairy products, meat, cleaning products, and shoe-making materials such as leather, soles, and glue. His goal is to maintain a high demand for his products and provide his family with a high quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, salt, coffee, soft drinks, dairy products, meat, cleaning products, and shoe-making materials such as leather, soles, and glue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows and to plaster his building.

loans.name: Shaheeda

texts.en:
Shaheeda is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son.

Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. For the past many days, his taxi has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the taxi.

Therefore, Shaheeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his taxi.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Romi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Romi. Romi lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. Romi owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile services for his community. He feels happy because Ruma’s sales executive is really helpful and informative.

Right now, Romi is becoming an agent of Ruma’s new product called Mapan. Mapan is e-commerce for lower communities. By providing Mapan to his customers, Romi will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Romi will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. After that, Ruma’s agent will come to his stall to collect the money and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to customer's door.

As the business grows, Romi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Romi improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Romi is the one who is standing in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services for his community

loans.name: Shamim Ara

texts.en:
Shamim Ara is 45 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for eight years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Shamim Ara's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of clothing material, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Shamim Ara has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband with buying tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Shamim Ara is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
