loans.use: to assist her husband in buying pieces of clothing material, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories for his business.

loans.name: Saima Bibi

texts.en:
Saima Bibi is 27 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. Over the past several days, his taxi has not been working properly, resulting in his being unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the taxi. 

Therefore, Saima Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing taxi.

loans.use: to assist her husband with covering the cost of repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Halamah

texts.en:
Halamah is a 45-year-old married mother of three children who resides in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She makes some income from selling fish at a market. Her husband is a 50-year-old fisherman. Two of her children work in a factory and the youngest one attends school. The family can earn around USD 25 each day. 

Halamah has been in difficulty because her present house has always been flooded in the flooding and rainy seasons, therefore she would like to request a loan to buy a plot of land to build a house on. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a plot of land to build a house on and live in better conditions. In the future, Halamah wants her children to be tailors and help her youngest child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a house

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is single with  two children and both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from selling chickens.  

Justine works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.She lives in a rented house with access to electricity but not to piped water. She would like to get a permanent stall at the market. Her major expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 50-year-old married woman from Khan Younis. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Two years ago, Salwa started working, selling canned food in a stall. She provides a good income which helps support the family and cover part of their expenses. 

Salwa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more canned food to resell in her stall. This will increase her sales and also her income.
 
Salwa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more canned food to resell in her stall.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lily Grace

texts.en:
Lily Grace is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lily Grace is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lily Grace has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Lily Grace requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Lily Grace has been in this business for one year. In the future, Lily Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucita is 57 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lucita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Lucita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 49-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing crops and rearing cattle for dairy production. In his business, he faces challenges of inadequate capital coupled with unpredictable weather changes where there is shortage of water and grass for his animals . However, he dreams of expanding his business to new areas. Steven has asked for a loan to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a hard-working, married man, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing green tea and at the same time he works as a mechanic, adding to his income. To earn additional income, he also hires out tea plantations, which supplements his tea sales. George faces challenges of price fluctuation of tea and weather changes, especially the dry season when tea harvests are very low, thus hindering growth of his business. 

George has asked for a loan to hire out a tea plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to hire out a tea plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a poultry project and at the same time owns rentals which earn her more income. She is faced with challenges of price fluctuation of poultry feed from time to time that makes it very expensive to access feed. Thus she goes without the feed and the chicks do not grow well. 

However, her dream is expanding her business to 10,000 layers and 6,000 broilers in the next 5 years. She needs a loan to buy poultry feed and vaccines for the chicks.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and vaccines for her chicks

loans.name: 3 De Abril Group

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 25, 16 y 14 años, y su negocios es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, de buen trato, sociable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca a mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad. De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Roxana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa blusa guinda). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; el mayor trabaja y los menores estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa en alquiler construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de transporte, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas, tejido a máquina, servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, venta de edredones y confección de polleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, poleras manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día de forma ambulante. “darle una segunda oportunidad a la ropa beneficia tanto a compradores como a vendedores…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa deportiva para dejar de ambular. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para venderla y pagar los gastos generales de sus 2 hijos menores.
texts.en:
Roxana is 39 years old, single, and the mother of three children aged 25, 16, and 14. She works selling second-hand clothes. Roxana is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, pleasant, sociable, responsible, and hardworking. She works in the southern part of the city, an area where, once a year, nearly one thousand craftspeople gather in the La Alasita fair to sell miniatures of every kind with the goal of making this miniature wish come true. The city has a hot and very humid tropical climate, and a nearly constant temperature of 30 °C (86 °F) throughout the year. 

Roxana is dark-skinned, short, and black-haired (she is shown in the photograph in the center, seated, and wearing a dark mauve shirt). Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish to communicate more widely and to conduct her business. She lives with her children. The oldest works and the minors go to school. They rent a brick house with a corrugated metal roof, which has running water, electricity, and sewer service. 

Roxana's desire for self-improvement motivated her to become the leader of a communal bank for business people (in areas such as transportation, fabrication of leather handbags, salteña (a kind of turnover) sales, machine weaving, equipment repair, furniture sales, duvet sales, and sewing of traditional skirts) to request loans and improve their businesses. Her business is to sell second-hand clothes such as pants, belts, short-sleeved shirts, Bermuda shorts, and others. Roxana works every weekday during the day as a street vendor, she says, "giving clothes a second chance to the benefit of both buyers and sellers". Her dream is to have a sportswear store and stop having to wander around. She would like to buy second-hand clothes wholesale and be able to meet demand during this season. Thus, Roxana is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothes wholesale to resell and pay the general expenses of her two youngest children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes wholesale to resell and pay the general expenses of her two youngest children.

loans.name: Lorenzo Javier

texts.es:
Son pocos los jóvenes como Lorenzo  que a sus diecinueve años de edad ya tienen trazados sus objetivos. Él está seguro que se va a sentir totalmente pleno cuando alcance su superación profesional. Es un estudiante comprometido en la universidad y apasionado por su curso de inglés, cree fielmente que entre más estudie, mayores oportunidades se le presentaran. Sus padres le brindan su apoyo incondicional hasta donde pueden, sobre todo lo forjan bajo significativos valores de convivencia, haciendo de él un joven ejemplar. 
Lorenzo actualmente está a poco tiempo de finalizar su curso de inglés y no quiere tener ninguna dificultad para poder lograrlo, es por eso que solicita préstamo para pagar los últimos niveles del curso y obtener su certificado de inglés como segunda lengua. Este joven considera que este curso es de vital importancia para su futuro personal y laboral.
texts.en:
Young people like Lorenzo are rare. At the age of 19, he has already laid out his goals. He is sure that he will feel complete when he becomes a professional. He is a dedicated university student and passionate about his English course. He sincerely believes that the more he studies, the more opportunities will come his way. His parents support him unconditionally as much as they can. They have given him strong values and made him into an exemplary youth.
Lorenzo is about to finish his English course and he does not want to have any problems with obtaining the credit. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay for the last levels of the course in order to obtain his English as a Second Language certificate. This young man considers this course to be of vital importance for his work and personal future.

loans.use: to pay for the final levels of an English course.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 37 years old, single, and manages a store for income. In his store, he sells breads, soap, shampoo, canned goods and other basic commodities. He wants to improve his income, so that is why he also includes selling soft drinks to the people in his village. 

He distributes soft drinks to different stores within his community. He is very diligent in improving his business. Now, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 43,000 to invest in expanding his business. He will buy additional grocery items and more cases of soft drinks to sell. 

He hopes to keep improving his sales, so he can reach out to more stores to sell soft drinks. He will also help other people by hiring them as helpers in his business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items and more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, coffee, eggs, groceries, etc.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, coffee, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jiandae Group

texts.en:
Asnati, who is in her early 20s, is married, with three children, twins and a single child, all of whom are still at school.  

Since 2003, she has been running two projects, selling cosmetics and selling things like ladies' bags, dresses, sarongs, and fabrics. She works from 9am to 7pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asnati's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her products and she has successfully paid back her loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees and she covered household expenses. 

Asnati will use this loan to buy a dryer and to increase her inventory of the fast-moving cosmetics. She dreams of buying a motorcycle. 

Asnati will share this loan with her loan group, Jiandae Group, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and increase her inventory of the fast-moving cosmetics.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than is a 51-year-old, married rice farmer with six children, and she lives in a village in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. So far, she has been a farmer for over 14 years. Among the children, one works as a construction worker, one works in the factory, one works in a farm and three others attend school. They can make an income of USD 21 a day. 

Than wants to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work, so she would like to take out a loan. She thinks that with the motorcycle, her children will be able to reduce the traveling expenses and have better traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes to renovate her house, and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the genge stock and to buy better products for plating the hair.

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en:
Thavry is a 30-year-old married factory worker with a child; she lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Thavry has been a factory worker since 2007. Her husband is a construction worker. Both Thavry and her husband can earn around USD 12 per day. 

Thavry and her husband live with their parents, and she wants to build an own house but she doesn’t have enough finances, so she would like to request a loan to buy construction materials to build a proper house. 

This loan will help her have enough finances to build her own house. 

In the future, she hopes that her husband can become a construction foreman. She will also send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a proper house

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 27-year-old married father of one young daughter and lives in Khanyounis city. Five years ago, Waleed opened a grocery store in the city where he sells basic grocery products to the local clients. 
Waleed took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more grocery products for his store to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income. 
Waleed appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child going to school. She is not looking after any other members of the family. She has been selling used clothes at a retail basis from the market for four years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to stock more used clothes to sell.  Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to become an importer of both new and secondhand shoes. 

She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans, and to save for a house that she plans to build for a rental house.  She stays in her own house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 31 years old, married, and had a child. She is managing a store for income. She sells grocery items at affordable prices. She wanted to earn more income, but she needs additional merchandise to sell, too. 

Because of this, she is now asking a loan of P15,000 to invest in her store. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar and noodles to sell.

Someday she hopes to keep increasing her profits and further improve the flow of income in her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar and noodles to sell

loans.name: Saffina

texts.en:
Saffina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single, with four children, all of whom are school-going. She is not looking after any other member of the family. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and fees.

She has been selling fish on a retail basis from the market for ten years, working six days a week.

She has requested for a loan of UShs 700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy fish to sell.  Her challenges include seasonality. 

Her dream is to start fish farming. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans, and to save for a house that she plans to build.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Savong

texts.en:
Savong, 21, is single and lives in a community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been employed as a teacher since 2014. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $5 a day.
She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting  a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 45-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Imelda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell  to her customers.

Imelda has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ledivina

texts.en:
Ledevina works hard to support her family. Ledevina is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ledevina has been in this business for 21 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ledevina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 59 years old and married with three children. Jessie works very hard to provide for her family.

Jessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and sugar.

Jessie has been in this business for 37 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and sugar.

loans.name: Hasmi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the new Ruma agents, Hasmi. Hasmi lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about 1 hour from Jakarta, the capital city.  He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. His wife is a full time housewife and mother. Hasmi owns a small stall where he sells drinks and provides more mobile payment services to his community. Hasmi knows Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He wants to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business.

As the business starts to run, Hasmi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Hasmi improve his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Hasmi is the one who is holding the glass. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services to his community

loans.name: Brok Group

texts.en:
Brok is a 39-year-old, married mother of two dependent children. She lives in the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. Her husband is 43 years old. The youngest child is in school. Brok, her husband, and the oldest child run a grocery and sell vegetables. In addition, they also cultivate rice. They can earn about USD 29 each day to support the family. 

Now Brok would like to apply for a group loan of three members, and she will use her portion to buy foundation parts for a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living conditions. In the future, Brok wants to buy more farmland to cultivate yams, renovate her house, and to help her child go through high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts for a latrine.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 31-year-old, married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and four kids; two sons and two daughters, in a small simple house. Three years ago, Rami opened a grocery store in the city where he sells basic grocery products to the local clients. 

Rami took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery products to sell in his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Rami appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the new Ruma agents, Taufik. Taufik lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about one hour from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children. His wife is a full time housewife and mother. Taufik owns a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services to his community. 

Taufik knows of Ruma from the sales executive who came to his stall. He wants to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business using technology. As the business starts to run, Taufik is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Taufik improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Taufik is the one who is smiling. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services for his community.

loans.name: Jonavie

texts.en: Jonavie is aged 28, married and they're blessed with two children. She has been in the junk shop business in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase used plastic bottles, old tires, scrap, and steel to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase used plastic bottles, tires, scrap, and steel to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, three of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other members of her family. She has been selling used clothes at the market at retail for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses.

She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes to sell. Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product. She lives in her own house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Pum is a 28-year-old, married factory worker with three young children, and she is from the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2013. Her husband is 33 years old and is also a factory worker. One of the children attends school. Both Pum and her husband can make around USD 10 each day.  

She would like to buy a motorcycle to commute to work; therefore she has decided to request a loan. This loan will help her and her husband have better traveling conditions. For more plans, Pum hopes to save money to run a business, build a proper house, and to help her children in earning bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising chickens. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bread to sell in her stall.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Zhainagul

texts.ru: Жайнагул, 56 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Жайнагул среднее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Жайнагул успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: корова, 15 овец. Бизнес Жайнагул на сегодняшний день приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 6,000 сом (KGS). Жайнагул решила обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни ее семьи.
texts.en: Zhainagul is 56 years old, married and the mother of three. Zhainagul has received secondary education. She is engaged in agricultural work. Zhainagul has her own  small farm, where she has one cow and 15 sheep. At present Zhainagul’s business brings in a monthly revenue of 6,000 KGS.  She has decided to apply to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep. She would like to increase her livestock and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Tereza es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 7 y 16, y su negocio es panadería tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, constante y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población proveniente de tribus nómadas del lugar como ‘Los Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país que hicieron de este sitio su hogar y generaron un comercio constante en todas las áreas.
Tereza es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo lo usa estilo cola de caballo, viste a la moda, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, usa blusa celeste y tiene una hoja en la mano). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como chofer asalariado y sus 3 hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor juega todo el día, viven en una casa propia de chapa y ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Debido a las necesidades de su familia y su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de comida, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, frutería y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es el horneado de pan tradicional, variedades como; pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), Mollete (Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca), Pan dulce (se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar), Rosca de maíz (a base de maíz), Tortilla (Es la masa de pan, que primeramente se aplana, se espolvorea con azúcar y harina, se dobla lo aplanado y se repite varias veces obteniendo después de cocido una especie de pan de hojaldre), etc. “el negocio de la panadería es una actividad constante, dónde no se puede parar ni un solo día; porque todos los días vienen los clientes a comprar…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante y ampliar su panadería, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial y compra de utensilios de cocina para la venta de comida. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Tereza solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y compra de utensilios de cocina para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Tereza, age 44, lives with her life partner.  She has three children, ages 3, 7, and 16.  Her business is a traditional bakery.

She is a good mother, independent, hard-working, steady, and very responsible.  She works at a market in the ‘Plan 3000’ area.  The area is known for the constant growth of its population that comes from the nomadic tribes like the ‘Ayoreso’ and the miners that have been relocated from the western part of the country.  They made this place their home, and they generated constant commerce in all areas.

Tereza has a dark complexion, is medium height, has long dark hair that she wears in a ponytail, and is fashionable.  Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish with the general public and for the business she conducts.  (She is standing and wearing a sky blue blouse, and she has a sheet of paper in her hand.)  

She lives with her life partner, who is a paid driver, and their three children.  The two oldest go to school, and the youngest plays all day.  They live in their own house made from metal sheeting and bricks.  They have water, electrical, and sewage services.  Due to the needs of her family and her business, she formed a bank of people with businesses like a video store, selling food, plaster handicrafts, selling soft drinks, bookstore, selling fruit, and selling meat.  She did this in order to request a loan and so that they could prosper in their business activities.

Her business is baking traditional break including varieties like rice bread (made from rice flower), ‘Mollete” (everyday bread made from flour, granulated sugar, and shortening), sweet bread (which uses raisins, egg, milk, and sugar), ‘Rosca de maíz’ (made from corn), ‘Tortilla’ (bread dough that is first rolled flat, sprinkled with sugar and flour, folded over, and repeated several times, which after it is baked it is a type of puff pastry bread), etc.  “The bakery business is a steady business activity where you cannot stop even one day because customers come to buy every day,” she says.

Her dream is to open a restaurant and to expand her bakery.  She wishes to invest in her business by purchasing an industrial oven and cooking utensils for food sales.  This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has been engaged in this business activity independently.

It is for these reasons that Tereza is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven and cooking utensils for food sales.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and kitchen utensils for food sales.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Lucy has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Glory has been in this business for four years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Glory would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to  sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Husnul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Husnul. Husnul lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children. He just joined Ruma a month ago. He was interested in joining Ruma because he heard a lot about Ruma's services. His community sees him as a trusted mobile service provider and he has a friendly and cheerful personality as well.

Right now, Husnul is becoming an agent of Ruma’s product called Mapan. Mapan is an e-commerce for lower communities. By serving Mapan to his customers, Husnul will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Husnul will simply send an SMS in a format to the SMS center and then the customer will pay him. After that, Ruma’s agent will come to his stall to collect the money and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door.

As the business starts to run, Husnul is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about its importance, your loan will be very useful to help Husnul improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Husnul is the one who is sitting and holding a Mapan poster. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services to his community

loans.name: Kufunafuna Group

texts.en:
Married with five children, Florence owns a grocery store in her community. She relies on this grocery store to provide for her family’s basic needs and welfare. Florence also looks after three orphans.  She would like to obtain another loan in order to purchase more commodities that are not currently in stock, and those that are highly demanded by people in her area. 

Purchasing these commodities will definitely help her to increase the supply, thereby also increasing the demand. She plans of further expanding her business into wholesale when she gains enough capital, and hopes to send her children to private schools.

loans.use: to buy assorted items.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 26-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells metals, a business he started with the hope of employing himself. He faces challenges of making losses, self injuries by metals and customers defaulting on him; all these make him yield fewer returns. However, he is hoping to expand into a large hardware store. Rashid has asked for a loan to buy materials for his business like iron bars and scrap to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business like iron bars and scrap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed, and a type of cow which produces more milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bundles of used clothing, which will allow her to increase her inventory and improve her financial situation.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, all of whom go to school. Janet also takes care of additional family members.

Working 6 days a week, Janet has been selling used clothing on a retail basis at the market for 2 years. She earns additional income from farming.

Janet has requested a 400,000 UGX loan from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to be able to stock more used clothing. Her challenges include seasonal changes in demand. Nevertheless, her dream is to become an importer of both new and second-hand shoes. 

Janet joined MCDT because of both the relatively low interest charged on loans and to begin saving for a house that she plans to build. Currently, she lives in a rented house with access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and fees.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes bazar-bodega, vende productos como arroz, azpucar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, cuenta con más de cinco años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de calzado y ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y de esta manera abastecer su negocio generando mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 47 years old and lives with her husband in the Oyotún district of Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. The people of the area work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching

She runs a general store/bodega, selling products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, among others. She has five years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in her neighborhood. She is seeking this loan to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing and shoes in order to stock her store and earn a better income for her family. This will allow her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to stock her store with men's, women's, and children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jose Eligio

texts.es:
José Eligio tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Eligio is a 57 years old married man. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a rural area where the people work in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which in part of the Lambayeque region in the north coast of Peru. 

He makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, hens, roosters and chickens, which he has done for the last few years.  He has his business in the back part of his home.  He is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed to fatten up his livestock, this way he can generate a better income for his family and therefor better his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up his animals

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, flour, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, flour, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Jely

texts.en:
Jely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new fishing nets and materials for fishing boat maintenance.

Jely has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets and materials for fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi is 32 years old, and married with two children is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, eggs, coffee, etc.

Mimi has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, spices, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 30 years of age, married, and the father of four children. He lives in Kasese Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop selling general merchandise for the last 13 years. He also grows and sells fruits such as passion fruits and vegetables in order to earn additional income and look after his family.

Edson used the previous loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. He now intends to use this new loan to buy sugar, soap, salt, passion fruits, millet flour and other merchandise to sell.

Though he is faced with the challenge of limited capital, he has a dream of educating his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, passion fruits, millet flour and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new electrical appliances, kitchen equipment, and more tables for her business.

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en:
Hadijja lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, and all of them attend school. She is also looking after additional family members. She has been selling fresh fish at retail from the market for the last ten years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more fresh fish to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and perishability of fish. She joined MCDT because the organization serves women and their children.
 
Her dream is to upgrade to a supplier and to buy a vehicle for the business. She rents a house with access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is widowed with 6 children, 4 of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. 

Zaituni sells used clothing at the market, a business she has been operating on retail basis for more than 5 years, 6 days a week. 

Zaituni has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to purchase a bale of used clothing. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonal demand. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business. 

Zaituni owns a house, and she and her family have access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Noren

texts.en:
Noren is 28 years old and has three children. With two of her children in school, Noren works very hard to provide for them.

Noren runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Noren has been in this business for one year now. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old. She is married and has one child.

Gina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her cattle.

She has been in this business for 25 years now and has borrowed from NWTF twice in the past to sustain it.

Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, fruits, beverages, groceries, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, fruits, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Wifred

texts.en: Wifred is a 23-year-old single lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a bar as her main business and in addition to that, she raises goats to sell which adds more income. In her business, she is faced with hardships of price fluctuation that hinder the growth of her business. She hopes to buy a plot where she can rear goats on a large scale. She has asked for a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en:
Fetije is a 52-year-old, widowed mother of two sons.  Her husband passed away when her two sons where still young. They are 26 and 22 now.  Fetije is applying for this loan so that she can pay the tuition fees of the oldest son who has been studying finance/accounting at the public university in Tirana, the capital city. However, Erion, the son who is in the photograph with her, is the youngest one and not the student. 

Fetije works as a teacher for a pay of $480/net a month. Her youngest son works in a nearby bar café for $200/month net pay. In addition to all the above incomes, Fetije has been practicing agriculture for about twenty years now. She owns sixteen dynym of agricultural land where she plants mainly wheat and just a little bit of seasonal veggies, with the latest ones to be used for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her son who studies finance & accounting in a public university.

loans.name: Muhameri Group

texts.fr: A l'âge de 20 ans, Jean Pierre a reçu de ses parents de champs de café comme héritage. Il sollicite ce crédit pour entretenir son champ car une main d'oeuvre irrégulière est un obstacle dans la culture du café. Il souhaite dans l'avenir construire une maison, assurer les frais scolaires et médicaux de sa famille. Sur la photo, Jean Pierre est au centre levant sa main droite.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 20 years old. He inherited a coffee field from his parents. He is requesting this loan to take care of it, because intermittent labor is detrimental to coffee cultivation.

In the future, he wishes to build a house and pay for his family’s school and healthcare expenses.

In the photo, Jean Pierre stands in the middle with his right hand raised.

loans.use: to take care of his coffee field.

loans.name: Rebacca

texts.en: Rebacca is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She is a tailor. She has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials to makes clothes and sandals. She generates additional income from selling chickens. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her goal is to start training other youth in her area to craft sandals. She lives in s rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes and crafting sandals.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov (shown in photo) is 20 years old, single, and lives with her family.  Sreypov lives along the Mekong river, around 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 

She is a student.  Now, she is in the first semester of her second year at Chenla University of Phnom Penh.  Her major will help her become a midwife. 

She would likes to apply for a loan for pay her school fee.  She will graduate in 2017. 

She strongly hopes that she will become a professional midwife and can improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Keopheatra

texts.en:
Keopheatra is a 20-year-old single son of a family from the Kratie province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in engineering, and is in his second year. His father is a Cambodian traditional-song musician and his mother is a farmer.

Keopheatra doesn’t have enough finances to cover his university fees from the second to the fifth year, so he would like a loan. The loan will help him graduate successfully and earn skills for his future job. After graduation, he dreams of working in any institution with a decent salary, so that he will be able to help his parents.

loans.use: to cover his university fees

loans.name: Herlinda Rosa

texts.es:
Herlinda Rosa tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su domicilio donde ofrece venta de ropa y calzado para niños, damas y caballeros desde hace diez años, por lo que cuenta con importante clientela.

Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada primavera – verano y de esta manera abastecer a sus clientes y así mismo generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Herlinda Rosa is 46 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun.  Its inhabitants work in agriculture, ranching and commerce.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo, the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru.

She has a small business in her home where she sells clothing and shoes for children, women and men.  She has done this for ten years, which is why she has a significant clientele. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy spring and summer clothing and in this way supply her clients, thus generating a larger income for her family which will permit her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for spring and summer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her mother. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include utilities and school fees.

Florence has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

Florence works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Factors that pose challenges for her business include seasonality and thieves. Her goal is to increase her capital base so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one which attends school.  She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She is residing in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

She has been operating a retail shop for the last 3 years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more soda, sugar, beans, peas, rice, flour, drinking water, and detergents for sale. 

Her challenges include transportation. 

Her dream is to build a store from which to carry out her business. 

She joined MCDT because it was relatively easy to join.

loans.use: to buy soda, flour, sugar, rice, beans, peas, and boxes of drinking water

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 27 years old with two children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosanie

texts.en:
Rosanie is 31 years old, married, and has four children, three of which are still in school.  Rosanie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.

Rosanie has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and has three children. With two of her children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like junk food, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for four years now. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like junk food, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old and has 2 children. She is married, and 1 of her children is still in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins.

Rowena has been running her business for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain it.

Rowena would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is a taxi driver from Armavir town. He lives with his wife and son who also provides taxi service to local people in Armavir town. 

To be able to purchase tires and pay for the repair of the car, Ara has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Ara hopes for lenders' support and goodwill, because it is very important for him to bring his car into working condition and restart providing taxi service.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and repair of the car

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr, using his own car, has been involved in providing cargo-shipping services for the past six years. He works and lives in Armavir town with his elderly, retired mother, his wife, and his 22-year-old son. 

Hrayr, bought his car last year on credit. Using the generated income, he is successfully paying back the debt for the car and, at the same time, providing for the necessary living conditions of his family members. 

To be able to repay in full the credit for the car, Hrayr has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for credit repayment of the car.

loans.name: Tulinje Group

texts.en:
Indira is a 42-year-old woman, married, with two children. She is a member of Tulinje Group.

Upon seeing her family's levels of poverty, she started selling second-hand clothes to people in her community and the surrounding area. She started this business hoping to lift her family out of poverty by being able to provide food and other basic needs to them. 

Indira will use the loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and this will help her to increase her returns.

She plans to open a shop in the near future and hopes to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 36-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started selling hardware five years ago in an attempt to increase his income and satisfy his family's needs.
 
Mohammad is working hard to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a van in order to transport his hardware easily. This loan will facilitate Mohammad's work as it will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a van in order to transport his hardware easily.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is a 58-year-old married farmer of two children. She resides in the Takeo province in Cambodia. 

She has cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1980. 

Her husband is 61 years old and he is a Cambodian traditional-song musician. One of the two children works as a construction worker. Together, they can make approximately $13 per day. 

Phally has decided to get a loan to buy lumber to build a house. This loan will help her and her family have a proper house to live in. 

Her plans are to expand her animal farm for more pigs and chickens and she also wants to build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 33-year-old married man from Jabalia. He lives with his wife and three children: two sons and one daughter. 

Saed works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Saed also has a stall for selling candy in the city. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Saed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more candy products from the wholesalers to sell on his stall and also distribute to the local traders. By taking this loan, Saed will be able to improve his business and also his income.
 
Saed appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more candy products from the wholesalers to sell on his stall and also distribute to the local traders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the soil for the new season by plowing it and buying fertilizers.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 28-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with one parent and she is the sole income provider. 

She has oweds a mini market since 2007 where she sells canned food, water, soft drinks, bread, and other dairy and daily products. At this time, Salwa states that she requires having more items in her store to sell as she intends to gain a higher income. 

To do so, she is asking a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. As for her future plans, Salwa states that she looks forward to enlarging her shop by requesting more Kiva loans.

loans.use: bring more items into her store

loans.name: Rut Liliana

texts.es:
Rut es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Turere’ un área caracterizada por la diversidad cultural, etnias del lugar como la ‘Ayorea’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país se asentaron en el lugar, pero también llegaron familias afectadas por las sequías, cambas pobres, collas nacidos en los más remotos rincones del país fueron arribando al nuevo barrio guaraníes y chiquitanos entre muchas otras etnias. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.

Rut es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negor largo amarrado como cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que recién van a empezar a estudiar en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, poleras manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día en un puesto de venta ambulante en la calle al aire libre. “escogí este negocio por la comodidad de trabajar junto a mis hijos, no tengo puesto de venta fijo; por eso me asiento donde me quede más cómodo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y grande para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rut solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rut is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children, ages 5 and 2. She is in business selling used clothing. She is enterprising, optimistic, happy, good-natured, responsible, hardworking, and a good mother. She runs her business in the Turere neighborhood, an area that is characterized by its cultural diversity; there are the local ethnic groups like the Ayorea, minors who have relocated from the western parts of the country and established themselves, families affected by drought, poor people from the region, indigenous Colla people born in the most remote corners of the country, Guaraní, Chiquitanos, and many other ethnic groups. The region has a tropical climate with an average temperature of 30 degrees Centigrade all year round.   

Rut is dark-skinned, of short stature, and has long black braided hair. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish in public and in her business. She shares her life with her children, who will soon start going to school. They live in a rented house made of brick with a corrugated tin roof that is equipped with running water, electricity, and full plumbing. 

Her business is selling used clothing, such as pants, belts, polo shirts, and shorts, among others. She works every day of the week, making mobile sales outside in the street.  She tells us that she chose this work for the convenience of working with her children close by. She does not have a fixed business location, so she sets up wherever is convenient. 

Her dream is to have a big business of her own so she can improve the living conditions for her children. She plans to buy used clothing at wholesale so she can offer a better selection and give her children a better life. This will be her first loan with Emprender, in three years of doing this work.

loans.use: to buy used clothing at wholesale so she can offer a better selection and give her children a better life.

loans.name: Reneboy

texts.en:
Reneboy is married and lives in Aloran, Philippines. For a living, he engages in running a fabrication business for the local community. Reneboy has been doing this for 12 years. He approached Paglaum MPC for the needed capital for his existing business. He applied for a loan of PHP 26,000 to purchase additional materials and equipment for his auto repair shop business. 

Reneboy is a regular and active member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies. He wants to completing his house and to live a happy and healthy life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials & equipment for his auto repair shop business

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en: Glenn makes a living through his internet cafe business. He runs an internet cafe in East Poblacion, Rizal, Philippines and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capitalization. He wants to increase his inventory. Now, he availed a loan to pay for computer accessories. Glenn hopes to sustain his business and dreams to have a family someday.

loans.use: to pay for computer accessories

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona, 32, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Roberto, her driver, she has three children who are still in the elementary level in school. She manages their household while operating a transport business.

Rona owns and oversees the operation of her jeepney service. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are constantly packed with passengers. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the Second World War, and are still seen throughout the Philippines, in many colors and all over the place. Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army who occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands in the Philippines. The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Rona is requesting a PHP 8000 loan, which she will use for repairs and maintenance of her jeepney. It is very important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her husband drives it, so she is assured that her jeepney is well taken cared of.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it funds schooling of her children and cover their daily sustenance.

Rona hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. She dreams for her children to get the best education. She prays for the safety of her husband in driving and for a better future for all of them. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y is a 46-year-old, married man, living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two sons. 

He earns a living sewing clothes and repairing motocycles for people in his community, which he has done for 19 years. 

Y would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of sewing materials in bulk. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. 

He also hopes that, through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of sewing materials in bulk.

loans.name: Cristelita

texts.en:
Cristelita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, noodles, spices, vegetables, etc.

Cristelita has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, noodles, spices, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old now. Francisca works very hard to provide her daily needs.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, cigarette, etc..

She has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, cigarette, etc.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives with his mother and owns a small garage to provide auto repair services. 
He has been involved in this business for four years. 

Gevorg renovates cars and sells auto parts in his garage. 

He will use the load  to purchase damaged cars for spare parts, which he can resell.   His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to repair damaged cars.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Romelyn is 37 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Romelyn has a seaweed cultured business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like plastic rope, empty bottles, etc.

Romelyn has been in this business for five years.  

In the future, Romelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like plastic rope, empty bottles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee to study banking and finance

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 53-year-old married woman from the village of  Metekhi. She has a son and daughter.  She is a baker and earns a small income.  She also raises pigs and chickens

Nana's husband works on a bus-line and serves local people. Nana helps her husband to achieve financial stability for their family  However, it becomes harder to earn a living overtime and the family members decided to have an additional source of income and start taxi business. Nana requested a loan to local financial institutions to gain an additional source of income for their children's welfare. She was approved with the loan of 6000 GEL to  purchase a car for her husband's taxi business. He will get his own costumers and significantly  increase the family's income.
 
Nana and her husband rely on the good will of lenders and are grateful for giving them a chance to become financial stability and have good living conditions.

loans.use: To start a new taxi service business.

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Non lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 52 years old and married with five children. To support her big family, she has been farming rice, cassava and raising pigs for 20 years. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day to make a living and she can afford to save 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her business. 

This is the fifth loan for Non with VisionFund. She has used the past loans successfully to support her family. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and plough the fields. She hopes to earn more income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plough the fields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Oun is 52 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are dependents. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice for 34 years. The current business earns her family about 37,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Oun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food and pay for her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current fishing business and earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is 44 years old, married and has two children, she lives in Wihdat, and her husband is working in car repair shop.
She is an ambitious woman who is always looking for the best to her life, Sanaa wants to improve the standard of living and she decided to work in any filed to increase her incomes. She started help her husband by working in weaving traditional clothing and she very happy with this work, she feels that she can prove her ability and her creativity in this work. 
She wanted to improve her income by selling more clothes. So she asked for a loan to buy sewing machine and more products to make more clothes and sell. She hopes to earn good profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and more products to make more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rini

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Rini. 

Rini lives in Cilegon, Banten, located about 3 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her 3 children. All of her children already have jobs, and her husband works as an employee. 

This is the 2nd time Rini has applied for a loan from Kiva's lenders. Her progress is quite impressive. She keeps improving her business, and she feels happy that she can give access to bill payment services to those who need it in her community. She also feels that her Ruma sales executive is really helpful, kind and informative.

As her business grows, Rini is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva's lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile phone bill payment services to her community. Your loan will be very useful in helping Rini improve her business and, accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. 

Rini is seen in the above photo. She will be thankful for your support.
