loans.use: to process more mobile services to her community

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven members who sell bathroom slippers, smoke fish, materials, and fishing nets. They have been group mates that repay loans and maintain savings for many years. The group members are residents of the Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group's sixth loan would be used to expand their businesses. They are involved in a variety of activities and together they have a solid foundation to guarantee the loan. The members are clear on collective loan guarantees and how to track their income and savings. They are empowered, hardworking, and determined men and women.

They will hold each other responsible to repay the loan. Rita is the featured borrower. She is a 52-year-old married woman. Rita sells polyester, soft drinks, and material. This loan will enable her to invest in her business. Her 29-year work experience has enabled her to  keep her in business. She is shown standing third from the left  in the photo. She has received training on problems such as drugs and crime, and  health subsidies.

loans.use: to buy  polyester, soft drinks, and materials.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika is 50 and has three children; 24, 22 and 20, with each one of them working; the oldest in a gas station, the middle in a cattle leather manufacture, and the youngest in a restaurant. 

She has been running a store in their village for fifteen years; she sells food and some other items such as toiletries. In addition to running the store, she also owns about eight dynyms (a tenth of a hectare) of agricultural land where she plants mainly corn; this year according to her, she only sold 20 quintal (50 kg) comparing to previous years that she had sold more. 

“The weather was terrible this year with lots of rains and snow; it damaged our products,” said Donika. She also has 15 beehives, yet did not sell any honey due to the fact that she did not do well in this activity either due to weather climate.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items in her food store

loans.name: Nyorko Do Group

texts.en:
This group is Nyorko Do Group, and it is comprised of five ladies who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan in the total amount of 4,000 GHS to invest into the sale of linings, cooking oil, vegetables, creams and clothing dye.

Juliet is a hardworking woman. She is a 36-year-old married woman with three dependable children. She lives with her family in Tehsie. She is the featured borrower of this group. Juliet studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Juliet started her business selling material lining and zips in a kiosk at her residence more than 15 years ago. She started her business with a small amount of working capital thanks to the assistance of her husband, who supported her financially. 

Year by year her business has improved, but most of what she earns in profits goes to the expenses of the family and savings. She has good experience in this business. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to enlarge her business, and she wants to improve it.  For this reason, she applied for a loan of 1,200 GHS from ID-Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase more material lining and zips and sell them to her customers. Juliet looks forward to expanding her business more in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase more material lining and zips, and sell them to her customers

loans.name: Kasangadzi Group

texts.en:
Abigail thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to boost her business by buying items necessary for her restaurant. Abigail is now able to pay school fees for her children and pay for their medical bills without facing any challenges. 

She is requesting another loan in order to open another business, as she also wants to start selling second hand clothes. She opted for this business since its highly demanded and it also brings more profits.

She plans of later opening a shop and hopes to build a better house for her family members. With the previous profits, Abigail is now self reliant as she does no longer depend on her husband.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new crockery for her husband's chef business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw for her brother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new juki machine for sewing fine clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of  milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mascara,  creams, and makeup for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zatonse Group

texts.en:
Elina thanks Kiva for the previous loan that she and her group obtained. She used her loan portion to buy more stock of fish, and this greatly helped her to increase her returns. She is now able to provide food and other necessities to her children without meeting any difficulties.

Elina is requesting another loan in order to further expand her business with the purchase of different kinds of fish. She will supply them to restaurants, from which she already has a number of orders.

Elina later plans to open her own restaurant. She also hopes to send her children to private schools.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 66 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, tiene 4 hijos dependientes, vive en el Distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de animales y comercio que se ubica en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, con más de 20 años en el negocio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos, con esto Agustina espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará un mayor ingreso, mejores ganancias y por ende mejorará la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 66-year-old widow with 4 dependent children.  She lives in the District of Cayalti, in a community with a varied climate.  Its inhabitants work in agriculture, animal sales and commerce.  It is located in the Province of Chiclayo, in the Region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru.

She works at raising and selling barnyard animals.  She has more than 20 years experience in this business and has many very good personal and work references from the area.  

She is asking for a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as to buy balanced food for them.  With this, Agustina hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, which will give her a larger income and better earnings, thus improving the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as to buy balanced food for them

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus, is aged 40, married, and blessed with three children. He has owned and managed a corn farm in his village for almost 15 years. Last harvest season, he earned an amount of PHP 60,000. His net income was usually spent on the school allowances of his children.

Due to having insufficient funds for his business, he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and seedlings to use on his farm . He's hoping that his farming business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, fertilizers, and seedlings to use on his farm.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar con su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella tiene su bodega en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 15 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, etc, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad en lo concerniente a productos de primera necesidad esto con la finalidad de poder satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 43 year old single mother, she lives in her family's home in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Laybayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. 

Life in this region is peaceful, the people who live here mainly make a living out of agriculture, livestock and small business. 

Marisol has a general store where she sells basics such as rice, sugar, oil and pasta amongst other things. Her store is located in her home. Maria has been making a living with this business for the last 15 years and has regular customers who offer many good personal and work references for Marisol. 

Marisol seeks a loan to buy a large quantity of rice, sugar, pasta, oil etc., in order to expand her business's stock. This in turn will allow her to have a greater variety of basic products, with the result being that she can satisfy her customers' preferences and thus increase her sales and continue to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, sugar, pasta, oil etc., in order to expand her business's stock.

loans.name: Segundo Heriberto

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Tiene más de 3 años de antigüedad en el negocio y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría (corrales). Con esto Segundo espera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 56 years old. He lives with his partner and their 3 children in the district of Oyotún, which can be found in the province of Chiclayo and the Lambayeque region in the north of Peru. Life in this area is tranquil and the people work as farmers, in livestock, and in business. 
Segundo works raising and selling pigs. His place of business is also his home. He has been running this business for more than 3 years and has many good personal and work references in the area. He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of pigs and also to make repairs to the pig sties. By doing this, Segundo hopes to haver a greater quantity of animals to his customers and so to generate greater income so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of pigs and to make repairs to their sties.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Neri tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Caserío El Sondor, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan. Cuenta con 08 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con esto Neri espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores niveles de venta y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Neri is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the village of El Sondor in a rural area of the district of Pomahuaca. The people there work in agriculture, business, and livestock. It is in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the mountains of the north of Peru.
Along with her husband, she is a farmer and grows coffee in particular. Her family is very united and works hard in all that they do. She has 8 years of experience in this business and very good personal and work references in the area. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to care for her coffee crops. By doing this, Neri hopes to offer a better quality of coffee to her customers and so to increase her level of sales in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and motorcycle passenger businesses. Analiza is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 40 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school Narcisa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, and groceries.

Narcisa has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Myrnalin

texts.en:
Myrnalin is 41 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, juice, groceries, etc. 

She has been running the general store for 5 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Myrnalin aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, juice, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dionesia is 65 years old now.

Dionesia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Dionesia has been in this business for 35 years. Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by making dried coconut meat in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional coconut to use in her business.

Gloria has been in this business for three years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to use  in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

Delia has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo lives with his wife in Sevqar village of Tavush region. 

He has been involved in the retail business for many years. Kamo sells construction materials in Sevqar village and nearby communities as well. 

To be able to purchase new construction materials for selling, Kamo asked for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Kamo does his best to earn a living for his family. His wife runs their farming business, but the main source of the family's income comes from Kamo's retail business. Thus, your support is very important for Kamo.

loans.use: to pay for construction supplies to resell in his business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 58, is a married woman with one child. She has a videoke rental business in the Philippines and has been in this business for a year. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Adelaida has requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan for maintenance for her videoke rental business.
 
In the future, Adelaida would like to further build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: for the maintenance of her videoke rental machine

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.ru: Иноятхон 51 год, в разводе, мать 4 детей. У Иноятхон среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 21 год занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Иноятхон, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 1 дойная корова и нетель. На ежедневной основе она реализует молоко. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,32 ГА, где Иноятхон выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Иноятхон и ее семьи составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Дети работают, помогают матери по хозяйству и материально. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Иноятхон намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что позволит ей накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Inoyatkhon is 51 years old, divorced and the mother of four. Inoyatkhon has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has been growing farm crops and raising livestock for 21 years. Thanks to Inoyatkhon’s resilience, commitment and hard work at present she has one dairy cow and one heifer. She sells milk on a daily bases. She also has a land plot of 0.32 ha [0.8 acres], where she grows corn. The total monthly income of Inoyatkhon and her family is about 10,000 KGS. Her children work too, helping their mother financially as well as with household tasks. Inoyatkhon has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS in order to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of environmentally clean milk produced on her farm. Inoyatkhon intends to keep increasing her livestock, which will allow her to save up for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Lilia Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilia Maria is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fish nets, etc. to use in her business.

Lilia Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additiional materials like fish  nets, etc.  to use in her business

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyet is 48 years old and lives with her one child and husband. Her husband works as a driver. For the past 6 years Tuyet has been running a general store from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family.

Tuyet is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the centre. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Tuyet is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products such as food and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Teófilo Rompan

texts.en: Teófilo is a small dairy farmer, who lives from selling his cows' milk and cultivating corn to produce their forage. He used to spend an important portion of his available income on LP gas and chemical fertilizers, and decided to invest in his biodigester to save money. Indeed, he will now be able to use his cows' manure as a resource and transform it into biogas and organic fertilizer. The biogas will be directly connected to his cookstove and boiler in the house, displacing fossil fuel-based LP gas. At the same time, the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer will replace chemical inputs, nourish the soils and increase the yield of Teófilo's corn field in a sustainable way. The untreated waste will no longer contaminate underground water sources, nor attract flies, while wood fuel will also be eliminated from the house, leading to improved health conditions for the whole family, as they will not inhale the toxic smoke anymore. With the savings Teófilo generates, he plans to put a roof on the backyard, and buy better quality food for his cows. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money selling clothes. For 3 years, she has been running a beauty salon that serve the people in her community.

Hanh would like a loan to purchase better quality nailcare and hairdressing tools to satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality nailcare and hairdressing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Etant célibataire, Adakou est une femme de 48 ans habitant à Lomé dans le quartier de Bè-Kpéhénou avec un enfant à sa charge. Adakou  se promène avec des sachets d’eau appelée Pure Water pour les vendre de quartier en quartier. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché de Lomé afin de disposer d’une bonne qualité qu’elle met en vente. En vue de réaliser encore plus de bénéfice, Adakou désire ce prêt pour améliorer sa vie et subvenir à ses besoins
texts.en:
A single lady, Adakou is 48 years old and lives in Lomé in the neighborhood called Bè-Kpéhénou with one child for whom she is responsible. Adakou walks around with small bags of water called Pure Water, selling them from one neighborhood to the next. She stocks up once a month in a market in Lomé so that she has a good many on hand to sell. 

Wishing to make more profit, Adakou wants this loan to improve her life and allow her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy 200 small bags full of Pure Water

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 33-year-old married woman who has three children (one is also shown in the photo).

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Shazia wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of the customers efficiently to get a boost in their earnings.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of the customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her husband's three-wheeled rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar system

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, él vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive solo no cuenta con ningun hijo a su cargo, cuenta con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Él vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza José es brindar servicios como maestro de obra en construcción civil, realiza construcciones de casas entre otros. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de madera para realizar construcciones así como herramientas para implementar su negocio, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, aged 44, lives in his own house, which is made of rustic materials. He lives alone and doesn't have any children in his care. He has good personal and work references. He lives in the rural area of the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

José provides services as a master builder in civil construction. He builds houses among other constructions.

He will use the loan to purchase timber as well as tools for his business. With this investment, he will be able to generate more income and, thus, improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase timber as well as tools for his business.

loans.name: Aibaniz

texts.en:
Aibaniz is 52 years old, widowed, and lives with her son and daughter-in-law in Bolnisi district. 

Aibaniz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a plot of agricultural land and grows potatoes and haricot. 

The harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Aibaniz decided to expand her agribusiness and purchase cows. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3,000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase cows and will start producing dairy products to sell. 

This will increase her income and Aibaniz will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cows and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money repairing motocycles. For 15 years, she has been running a general store that sells many items to people in her community.

Thuy would like a loan to purchase better quality products, such as beverages and household items to satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality products, such as beverages and household items to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian tiene 56 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de maíz amarillo, tiene diez años de experiencia en este negocio y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito que solicita lo va a invertir como capital de trabajo para la compra de fertilizantes, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Esta inversión le permitirá ofrecer un maíz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 56 years old, married, and lives in his own house in the district of Querocotillo, which can be found in the province of Cutervo and the Cajamarca region in the mountains of the north of Peru. The principle economic activities in this area are agriculture, livestock rearing, and business. 
He works growing yellow corn. He has 10 years of experience doing this and has good personal and work references in the area. He will use the loan as business capital to buy fertilizer and supplies and to pay for labor for the harvest season. This investment will enable him to offer better quality corn to his customers and will will have a positive effect on his sales. This will ultimately improve his family's quality of life.
Cheers,
Alison

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies and to pay for labor for the harvest season.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 40 years old. She is divorced and lives with her 2 children. Nino is unemployed at the moment and her family lives in poverty. 

She decided to start a clothing business and requested a loan. 

The start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 300 USD. With the received credit she will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and will resell them with a price markup. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for her family. 

Nino awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale to resell

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron is a widowed Egyptian Albanian father.  He has a married son and the two children in the photograph are his daughters. They live in the city of Korca where the majority of their community has resided for generations. 

During the communist era, they lived either in the shacks in suburbia, or in the basements of apartment buildings; in both situations they lived under extreme poverty.

For almost ten years, Agron has been in the wholesale buying/selling business of fresh produce, such as fruits and vegetables and also collects scrap metal and plastic and sells it for cash. His son has joined him in both activities. 

In order to do both, they needed two sorts of vehicles, locally called ‘tricycles’ that currently have expired papers for operation. 

The loan that Agron is requesting from lenders will be used for this purpose.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of motorcycle papers

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond wants your help to pay for seeds that he will plant soon; he also wants to buy pesticides and prepare the soil for planting with the rest of the loan.

He's got 14 dynym (1 dynym is equal to 1,000 sq. meters) of agricultural land in his name, and his wife has about 6 dynyms.  

They mainly plant potatoes, onions, beans, corn and wheat.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds for planting,  to buy pesticides, and to prepare the soil for planting

loans.name: Phearun

texts.en:
Phearun is a 21-year-old student who lives with his family  in the Posen Chey district  of Phnom Penh Cambodia. 

He is in his second year, 2nd semester of a nursing program at the  International University (IU). He would like to apply for a loan to pay for school fees. 
He will graduate October 15,  2016 and hopes to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her sister. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last five years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT - SACCO to enable her to buy bags of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and do away with paying rental dues for the stall in the market where she operates. 

She joined MCDT - SACCO because she failed to get financial assistance from relatives. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school dues and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor cocinando para asistir a los jornaleros con el refrigerio, son una familia unida. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, de esta manera Humberto espera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is 60 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Colosay. This is a community where the people work in agriculture, business, and livestock, and it is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the mountains in the north of Peru. 
Humberto works as a farmer, growing coffee in particular. His wife supports him in this work, cooking for the laborers and assisting with refreshments. They have a united family. His has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to care for his coffee crops. In this way, Humberto hopes to have a good harvest to offer to his customers and to generate greater income. This will enable him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to care for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Uulbubu

texts.ru: Уулбубу 59 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, младшая дочь ходит в школу. У Уулбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 41 год назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Уулбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 12 коров, 27 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 23,000 сом (KGS) с учетом пенсии Уулбубу и ее супруга. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров для откорма. Доходы от кредита Уулбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Uulbubu is 59, married, and the mother of four children. Her youngest daughter goes to school. Uulbubu has a secondary education and earns the main income for her family raising livestock, which she began 41 years ago when she bought livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Uulbubu currently has 12 cows and 27 sheep. Her monthly income is around 23,000 som (KGS), including her and her husband's pensions. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy four cows to fatten. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy four cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, donde la vida es tranquila ya que es una comunidad rural y pequeña que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto ella espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que va a permitirle mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 57 years old and lives with her partner in the district of Cayaltí, where life is tranquil as this is a small rural community. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the coast of the north of Peru. The people in this district work in agriculture, livestock, and business. 
Fredesvinda raises and sells animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and others. She has more than 20 years of experience in this business and has very good personal and work references in the district. She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of animals and also nutritionally-balanced animal feed to fatten them up. In this way, she hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers and to generate more income so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals and balanced feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with one son and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 17 years, she has run an electrical and water equipment store that sells many items for people in her community.

Huong would like a loan to purchase better quality electrical items and water piping to stock her store and sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase electrical items and water piping to sell from her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a welding plant.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 25 years old and single. She has worked for two years in this business. She owns a mini-market where she sells clothing to her customers. A loan of 300 SSP will help her to get more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase smooth wooden  boards and bamboo.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 40 years old. She is divorced and looks after her daughter alone. She lives in the Kaspi district. Irma works at a local kindergarten and gets a small monthly income. Irma decided to increase her family's income and requests a loan for a business start up. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 550 GEL. With the received credit Irma will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then will resell among her villagers with the price marked up. This will give her a chance to increase her income and improve the living conditions for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then resell with the price marked up in order to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members who work by selling water gari, pure water, rice, silver sets, foodstuffs, and general goods. They have been group mates, repaying loans and maintaining savings, for five years. The request for the group's third loan will be used to expand their businesses. They are involved in a variety of activities, and together they have a solid foundation to guarantee the loan. The members are clear on how to track their income, collective loan guarantees, and savings. The group members are residents of Teshie, Accra, Ghana. 

Gladys is the featured borrower. She is 40 years old, married and has four dependable children. Gladys sells foodstuffs (cassava, plantain and vegetables), and this loan will enable her to invest in her business. Her family helps her take care of the home while she handles the selling aspect of the business. Her 6 years of working experience have strengthened her to strategically sustain her business. She has received training in business management and the provision of health subsidies. The group are empowered, hard-working and determined women. They will hold each other accountable for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs (cassava, plantain, and vegetables) to sell to customers at her residence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, sweet peppers, onions, potatoes, soda pop and juices.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 10 y 5 años, y su negocio es el horneado de tortas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, constante y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población proveniente de tribus nómadas del lugar como ‘Los Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país que hicieron de este sitio su hogar y generaron un comercio constante en todas las áreas.
Ruth es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa estilo cola de caballo, viste a la moda, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro usa blusa rosada). Su vida la realiza con sus 4 hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor juega todo el día, viven en una casa propia de chapa y ladrillo que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Debido a las necesidades de su familia y su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortas y postres, negocio que comenzó desde su casa, haciendo una mínima inversión con la venta de alfajores, queques de vainilla y tortas de chocolates que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de postres para el público. “las tortas son antojos que los clientes compran y saborean a cualquier hora del día, en la mañana junto al desayuno, como postre después de almuerzo, en la tarde con un café y en la noche como cena…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pastelería grande y vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ruth solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial, una garrafa de gas para ampliar su negocio y abastecer los gastos de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth, 32, is single and has four children, ages 16, 14, 10, and 5.  She's a good mother and an independent, hardworking, persevering, and very responsible woman.

Her business is baking cakes.  She works in a market in the Plan 3000 area, known for its ongoing population growth from nomadic tribes in the area such as the Ayoreos and miners who migrated from the western part of the country; they made this place their home and generated constant commerce in all the areas.

Ruth is short and dark, and she wears her long black hair in a pony tail and dresses fashionably.  (She's seated in the middle, wearing a pink blouse.)  Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for her business.  

She lives with her four children.  The three older ones attend school and the youngest plays all day.  They live in their own house made of corrugated metal and brick, and they have running water, electricity, and a sewage system.

As a result of her family and business needs she formed a bank with people with businesses like a neighborhood store, a butcher shop, sandwich sales, plaster handicrafts, soft drink sales, a bookstore, and clothing sales.  Their objective was to request a loan and prosper in their commercial activities.

Ruth's business is making and selling cakes and desserts.  She started from home, making a minimal investment with sales of "alfajores" [sandwich cookies], vanilla cakes, and chocolate cakes that have ingredients that are easy to find in the market.  As she recovered her capital, she invest in selling cakes to the public.  "Customers buy and crave cakes any time of day: in the morning with their breakfast, as a dessert after lunch, in the afternoon with a cup of coffee, and at night as dinner," she said.  Her dream is to have a large bakery and sell wholesale.

For those reasons Ruth is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven and a tank of gas to expand her business and cover the expenses of her four children.  This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the three years she has been in this line of work.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and a tank of gas to expand her business and cover the expenses of her four children

loans.name: Jesus Esteban

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar con su madre en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera Jesus espera la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto, eso le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jesus is 29 years old, single, lives in the family home with his mother in the Pomahuaca District, which is located in the province of Jaén, of the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Perú. The population in this district makes a living from agriculture, livestock and trade. He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee crops, with eight years of experience in the field. He has very good personal and work references in his district.

He will use the loan for agricultural tasks, such as application and incorporation of pesticide and fertilizer products, as well for labor during harvesting. As a result, Jesus anticipates the physiological, morphological and prolific improvement of his crop, as well as to have a timely harvest, and hence, an increased production and better crop quality which he will have no problems selling and will also generate higher revenues that will allow him a better quality of life.

loans.use: with agricultural tasks, such as the application and incorporation of pesticide and fertilizer products, as well for labor during harvesting.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik lives in the town of Armavir with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

He has had a delivery service for 6 years which uses his own bicycle to deliver ice-cream. 

He requests a loan  to purchase a motorcycle to deliver and expand his territory.  

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans  to informal businesses that do not  qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is a 41-year-old married, business man with 3 children,  from the eastern part of the country. His wife is housekeeper and he has worked at a government agency for social security for  four years. He is a driver and is a responsible, hardworking, brave, and helpful person. 

His car needs to be repaired. He will use the load to repair his car. Shurat is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru: Акылай, 27 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Акылай- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 9 лет назад и развила его. В хозяйстве Акылай есть 4 коровы, 25 овец. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Акылай составляет 11,500 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Акылай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Akylai is 27, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock. She started her own business nine years ago and developed it. She has four cows and 25 sheep and currently earns 11,500 som (KGS) per month. She applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to use the profits to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer and a kitchen in order to continue working and cover family expenses.

loans.name: Carlos Alonso

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de soldador metálico contando con herramientas de trabajo propias, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para la construcción y arreglos de su casa, comprará adobes, cemento y calaminas para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda, con esto Carlos piensa mejorar sus condiciones de vida lo que le permitirá vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23. He is single, he lives with his family in the Oyotún district, which is found located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru. Its population mainly works in agriculture and animal raising.

He works providing services of a metallic solderer, having his own work tools. He has more than three years' experience in the business and with clients who bring him very good personal and work references. He is applying for a loan for construction and repairs to his house. He will buy adobe bricks, cement and roofing to carry out repairs in his home. With this, Carlos thinks of improving his living conditions, which will allow him to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to do construction and repairs to his house, to buy adobe bricks, cement and roofing.
